bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alberto Recio , August 16, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests permission to borrow "Memoria del Hospital Numero Uno." He hopes that an accurate survey of Camp Lazear can be made. Hench heard that the entire Cuban government resigned and is wondering whether Ramos is still Minister of National of Defense, and still able to help him.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alberto Recio , August 16, 1941
div1.opener:
August 16, 1941
Dr. Alberto Recio
Paseo de Carlos III 1117
La Habana
Cuba
My dear Doctor Recio:
div1.p:
I will be so grateful if you can borrow from
the librarian of the Academy of Medicine the book “Memoria
del Hospital Nùmero Uno” by Calliol, 1903. I requested
this from the librarian of the Finlay Institute, as I told
you they have a copy but since it is their only copy they
are afraid to lend it to me. Perhaps the librarian of the
Academy of Medicine would be more generous and would permit
it to be sent to me by registered mail. I assure you I
would take extreme care of it and return it by registered
insured mail. If this is not possible, I would be very
grateful if you would tell me how much it would cost me to
have the entire book photostated.

I appreciate greatly your continued sympathetic
interest in my efforts. I hope indeed that you can have
an accurate survey of Camp Lazear made. I noticed in the
paper that the Cuban government had resigned en bloc and
wondered whether Dr. Ramos were still Minister of National
Defense and whether he would be able to maintain his interest
and continue to help me.
With kindest personal regards, I am,
div1.closer: Sincerelyy yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
